Translations.Text: He frowned and turned away
Because there came to him the blind man
And how can you know that he might become pure
Or he might receive admonition, and the admonition might profit him
As for him who thinks himself self-sufficient
To him you attend
What does it matter to you if he will not become pure
But as for him who came to you running
And is afraid
Of him you are neglectful and divert your attention to another
Nay; indeed it is an admonition
So, whoever wills, let him pay attention to Him (it)
In Records held in honor
Exalted, purified
In the hands of ambassadors (Safarah)
Honorable and obedient
Qutila mankind! How ungrateful he is
From what thing did He create him
From a Nutfah He created him and then set him in due proportion
Then He made the path easy for him
Then He causes him to die and puts him in his grave
Then when it is His will, He will resurrect him
Nay, but has not done what He commanded him
Then let man look at his food
We pour forth water in abundance
And We split the earth in clefts
And We cause therein Habb to grow
And grapes and Qadb
And olives and date palms
And Ghulb Hada'iq
And fruits (Fakihah) and herbage (Abb)
A provision and benefit for you and your cattle
Then when there comes As-Sakhkhah
That Day shall a man flee from his brother
And from his mother and his father
And from his wife and his children
Every man that Day will have enough to make him careless of others
Some faces that Day will be bright
Laughing, rejoicing at good news
And other faces that Day will be dust-stained
Darkness will cover them
Such will be the disbelieving, the wicked evil doers
When the sun is Kuwwirat
And when the stars Inkadarat
And when the mountains are made to pass away
And when the pregnant she-camels are neglected
And when the wild beasts are gathered together
And when the seas become as blazing fire
And when the souls are joined with their mates
And when the female infant (Al-Maw'udah) buried alive is questioned (Su'ilat)
For what sin was she killed
And when the pages are laid open
And when the heaven is Kushitat
And when Hell is Su`irat
And when Paradise is brought near
Every person will know what he has brought
But nay! I swear by Al-Khunnas
Al-Jawar Al-Kunnas
And by the night when it `As`as
And by the day when it Tanaffas
Verily, this is the Word a most honorable messenger
Dhi Quwwah, with the Lord of the Throne -- Makin
Obeyed there, trustworthy
And your companion is not a madman
And indeed he saw him in the clear horizon
And he withholds not a knowledge of the Unseen
And it is not the word of the outcast Shaytan
Then where are you going
Verily, this is no less than a Reminder for the creatures
To whomsoever among you who wills to walk straight
And you cannot will unless that Allah wills -- the Lord of all that exists
